step_1.title: Analyze the Question
step_1.description: Read the last sentence first, decompose the question into core project management principles (e.g., scope, time, risk). Identify key components and ensure you understand the core query.

step_2.title: Verify Context
step_2.description: Ensure all necessary context is present. Ask clarifying questions if any information is missing (e.g., project phase, stakeholder involvement).

step_3.title: Logical Analysis
step_3.description: Follow a step-by-step logic template, considering dependencies, risks, and consequences for the recommended solution. Ensure all steps are covered.

step_4.title: Validate Against PMBOK Standards
step_4.description: Ensure the solution aligns with PMBOK knowledge areas and process groups. Cross-check the response with PMBOK guidelines for accuracy.

step_5.title: Self-Check for Errors
step_5.description: Before finalizing the response, check for logical gaps or errors. Correct any inconsistencies and ensure the response is thorough and well-reasoned.

step_1.title: Review Feedback and Errors
step_1.description: Analyze the feedback received and review error logs. Identify frequent mistakes, patterns, and prioritize areas for correction.

step_2.title: Update Persona
step_2.description: Adjust the agent's persona based on feedback. Modify communication style or tone to better suit user needs, if required.

step_3.title: Refine Logic Template
step_3.description: Update the agent’s logic process. Add steps or checks if gaps were found, or correct existing logic errors based on feedback.

step_4.title: Refine Guidelines
step_4.description: Incorporate lessons learned from mistakes into the guidelines. Add any new terms or processes to prevent future errors.

step_5.title: Log Improvements
step_5.description: Record all changes made to the agent’s persona, logic template, and guidelines. Use the `save_data()` function to log improvements and track progress over time.
